sentences.en: A barge was about a hundred yards away, waiting to return seaward.
sentences.cn: 一艘驳船停在大约100码开外，等待着返海回航。

sentences.en: A freighter slipped by, heading seaward.
sentences.cn: 一艘货船朝着海洋方向驶去.

sentences.en: Anchorage usually develops in the Southwest seaward slope.
sentences.cn: 锚地大都发育在西南向海坡.

sentences.en: From the hill he took a seaward course.
sentences.cn: 他走了一条从山上到海边的小路.

sentences.en: It faced seawards to the north.
Keep to the seaward side of the path.
sentences.cn: 沿着路上靠海的一侧走。

sentences.en: Particles size decreases seaward down the distal front of the bar.
sentences.cn: 微粒大小沿海的沙洲末梢方向减小.

sentences.en: Six slippery snails, slid slowly seaward.
sentences.cn: 六只湿滑的蜗牛慢慢地滑向海边.

sentences.en: The houses on the seaward side of the road were all in ruins.
sentences.cn: 马路临海一侧的房子全部沦为废墟。

sentences.en: The seaward pull of receding waves after they break on a shore.
sentences.cn: 回头浪在浪碰到海岸后,撤回的浪向海的牵拉.

sentences.en: the seaward side of the coastal road
The tug was seaward of the Hakai Passage on a course that diverged from the Calvert Island coastline.
sentences.cn: 托船驶离卡尔弗特岛海岸朝哈凯航道驶去。

sentences.en: We four affectionately watched his back as he stood in the bows looking to seaward.
sentences.cn: 他站在船头向海上了望时,我们四个人都热切地朝着他的背影望着.

sentences.en: We left the harbor and sailed seaward.
sentences.cn: 我们离开港口,朝海上航行.

sentences.en: Woodshadows floated silently by through the morning peace from the stairhead seaward where he gazed.
sentences.cn: 树林的阴影穿过清晨的寂静,从楼梯口悄然无声地飘向他正在眺望着的大海.

trans.tran_en: Something that moves or faces seaward or seawards moves or faces in the direction of the sea or further out to sea
